action.action-desc: Mr. Perry (for himself, Mr. Norman, and Mr. Roy) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To exempt certain vessels transporting liquefied natural gas from certain coastwise endorsement requirements, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American LNG First Act of 2022.

section.header: Exemption from coastwise laws for vessels transporting liquefied natural gas

subsection.text: Section 12103 of title 46, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Exception for vessels transporting liquefied natural gas

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding subsection (a), a certificate of documentation may be issued under this chapter for any vessel transporting methane, refrigerated liquid, commonly known as liquefied natural gas.

subparagraph.text: a vessel that is owned, in whole or in part, by—

clause.text: the Government of the Russian Federation;

subparagraph.text: a vessel for which any crewmember is a Russian national.

subsection.text: Section 12112(a)(2)(B) of title 46, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in clause (ii) by striking or at the end;
in clause (iii) by striking and at the end and inserting or; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: transports methane, refrigerated liquid, commonly known as liquefied natural gas; and
